perturbation.original_text: 12.1 Distributor shall have the option to return to Cisco, for credit, up [*****] of the dollar value of Products from the Wholesale Price List (or, if no Wholesale Price Lists exists for Distributor's Territory, then the applicable price list) shipped to Distributor, net of credits, less returns to Cisco, in the preceding [*****] period (the "Balancing Cap") of the preceding Cisco fiscal quarter. The above-referenced cap shall be determined based on all Product purchases made under this Agreement. The responsibility to manage the Balancing Cap shall rest solely upon Distributor. Distributor shall be entitled to return Product once per quarter, provided such returns do not exceed the Balancing Cap. "Dead on Arrival" and Obsolete Products returned pursuant to Section 13 of this Agreement shall be excluded from calculation of the Balancing Cap. Cisco shall credit Distributor's account in the amount of the price paid by Distributor therefore, less any price protection credits issued to Distributor related to the Product returned (the "Return Credit").
perturbation.changed_text: 12.1 Distributor shall have the option to return to Cisco, for credit, up [*****] of the dollar value of Products from the Wholesale Price List (or, if no Wholesale Price Lists exists for Distributor's Territory, then the applicable price list) shipped to Distributor, net of credits, less returns to Cisco, in the preceding [*****] period (the "Balancing Cap") of the preceding Cisco fiscal quarter. The above-referenced cap shall be determined based on all Product purchases made under this Agreement. The responsibility to manage the Balancing Cap shall rest solely upon Distributor. Distributor shall be entitled to return Product once per year, provided such returns do not exceed the Balancing Cap. "Dead on Arrival" and Obsolete Products returned pursuant to Section 13 of this Agreement shall be excluded from calculation of the Balancing Cap. Cisco shall credit Distributor's account in the amount of the price paid by Distributor therefore, less any price protection credits issued to Distributor related to the Product returned (the "Return Credit").
perturbation.explanation: By changing "once per quarter" to "once per year", this modification creates a less frequent return option for the distributor. This conflicts with general commercial reasonableness standards, as quarterly returns are more common and accepted practice in distribution agreements, especially regarding electronics and technology. This change is unfavorable to the distributor and can be challenged based on good faith and fair dealing principles.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) - implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing.

perturbation.original_text: 5.0 All capitalized terms not defined in this Amendment No. 3 shall have the meaning assigned to them in the Agreement. In the event of conflict between the terms of this Amendment No. 3 and the Agreement, the terms of this Amendment No. 3 shall prevail. All other terms and conditions of the Agreement remain unchanged.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.0 All capitalized terms not defined in this Amendment No. 3 shall have the meaning assigned to them in the Agreement. In the event of conflict between the terms of this Amendment No. 3 and the Agreement, the original Agreement shall prevail. All other terms and conditions of the Agreement remain unchanged.
perturbation.explanation: By stipulating that the original agreement shall prevail in case of a conflict, instead of the amendment, it creates uncertainty in the parties' obligations and may render the amendment ineffective. This violates the general principle of contract law that later agreements (amendments) supersede prior agreements to the extent of any inconsistency. This contradiction makes the amendment potentially unenforceable and contradicts legal standards for contract modifications.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding the precedence of later agreements (amendments) over earlier agreements.

perturbation.changed_text: (e) Distributor's key personnel who directly support Cisco's account have or will have completed training (provided by Distributor, Cisco Cisco's on-line anti-corruption training is available in numerous languages and is free of charge for up to five of Distributor's personnel at http://corpedia.com/clients/cisco/pre_reg.asp?lid-300446001., or another third party) on compliance with applicable anti-corruption laws within the past 36 months (from the date when this Agreement becomes effective);
perturbation.explanation: The modification extends the anti-corruption training interval from 12 months to 36 months. For industries that requires regular compliance to anti-corruption training, 36 months is considered too long and can be challenged legally in court if the company were to encounter legal issues with the authorities for corruption, due to not following the best practice standards with employee corruption training.
